meanings.definition: A person who asks for or takes things from others without paying or giving anything in return.
meanings.sent1: The moochers always expected free food at the party.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood moochers would often borrow tools and never return them.
meanings.sent3: The moochers at the picnic kept asking for more snacks.
meanings.sent4: The moochers in the office were like hungry seagulls swooping in for leftovers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the moochers scavenging for handouts was hard to forget.

meanings.definition: To ask for or take things from others without paying or giving anything in return.
meanings.sent1: She would moochers snacks from her friends during lunch.
meanings.sent2: He always moochers rides from his coworkers after work.
meanings.sent3: The cat would moochers attention by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The vines seemed to moochers nutrients from the soil around them.
meanings.sent5: The student moochers answers from their classmates during the test.
